# Substitution variables match the column names of the rules converted to camelCase. For example: Target-Trait rule column value is represented as targetTrait substitution variable in hint text.
# Example substitution variables:
#    attribute - the name of the attribute being evaluated by a rule (for example: 'wings' or 'sex')
#    targetTrait - the targetTrait value for the rule (for example: for the wings attribute: 'wings' or 'wingless' and for the sex attribute:  'male' or 'female')
#    selectedTrait - the selectedTrait value for the rule (for example: for the wings attribute: 'wings' or 'wingless' and for the sex attribute:  'male' or 'female')
#    incorrectParent - this value is specified in the breeding rule sheets (mom | dad | parent)

LG1.C2a
Sim

Let's look only at [attribute: shininess, wings, arms, legs, gray, color, horns, nose spikes, deep color]. What can you change to make a drake that [targetTrait: is shiny, has wings, has arms, has legs, is gray, has color, is hornless, is spiked, has deep color]?

[attribute: Shininess is, Wings are, Arms are, Legs are, Gray is, Color is, Hornless is, Nose spike is, Deep color is] a dominant trait. If a drake has at least one "[targetTrait: shiny, wings, arms, legs, gray, color, hornless, spiked, deep]" allele, it will [targetTrait: be shiny, have wings, have arms, have legs, be gray, have color, be hornless, have a nose spike, have deep color].

Your drake is still [selectedTrait: dull, wingless, armless, legless, not gray, without color, has horns, spikeless, faded color]! To make a drake that [targetTrait: is shiny, has wings, has arms, has legs, is gray, has color, is hornless, has a nose spike, has deep color], set one allele to [targetTrait: shiny, wings, arms, legs, gray, color, hornless, spiked, deep] and see what happens!
LG1.C2b
Sim

Let's look only at [attribute: shininess, wings, arms, legs, is gray, color, horns, nose spike, deep color, tails]. What can you change to make a drake that [targetTrait: is dull, is wingless, is armless, is legless, is orange, is albino, has horns, is spikeless, has faded color, has a short tail]?

[targetTrait: Dullness is, Wingless is, Armless is, Legless is, Orange is, Albino is, Horns are, Spikeless is, Faded color is, Short tails are] a recessive trait. A drake needs two [targetTrait: dull, wingless, armless, legless, orange, albino, horns, spikeless, faded, short tail] alleles to [targetTrait: be dull, be wingless, be armless, be legless, be orange, be albino, have horns, be spikeless, have faded color, have a short tail].

Your drake [selectedTrait: is shiny, has wings, has arms, has legs, is gray, has color, is hornless, has a nose spike, has deep color]! To make a drake that [targetTrait: is dull, is wingless, is armless, is legless, is orange, is albino, has horns, is spikeless, has faded color, has a short tail], set both alleles to [targetTrait: dull, wingless, armless, legless, orange, albino, horns, spikeless, faded, short tail] and see what happens!

Let's look only at [attribute: color]. What can you change to make a drake that [targetTrait: is albino]?
[targetTrait: Albino is] a recessive trait. A drake needs two [targetTrait: albino] alleles to [targetTrait: be albino].
Your drake [selectedTrait: has color]! To make a drake that [targetTrait: is albino], set both alleles to [targetTrait: albino] and see what happens!
LG99.A
Sim
This drake already [attribute: was shiny, had wings, had arms, had legs, was gray, had color, was hornless, had a nose spike, had deep color]. Are you sure that last move was necessary?

[attribute: Shininess is, Wings are, Arms are, Legs are, Gray is, Color is, Hornless is, Nose spike is, Deep color is] a dominant trait. A drake only needs one "[selectedTrait : shiny, wings, arms, legs, gray, color, hornless, spiked, deep]" allele to [selectedTrait : be shiny, have wings, have arms, have legs, be gray, have color, be hornless, have a nose spike, have deep color]. To earn a higher crystal, don't change unnecessary alleles!
A dominant trait like [selectedTrait: shiny, wings, arms, legs, gray, color, hornless] only requires one allele. To earn a higher crystal, don't change unnecessary alleles!

Sim
Let's look only at [attribute: armor]. Sometimes alleles combine to create a trait that is inbetween a dominant and recessive trait. Change one armor allele and see what happens!
Your drake still has [selectedTrait]! 0 armor plates is recessive and 5 armor plates is dominant. What do you need to change to get [targetTrait]?
Set the alleles so that your drake has [targetTrait]. Drakes with 3 armor plates have one no armor allele and one full armor allele!

The drake you created is [selectedSex] but the target drake is [targetSex]! Hint: Look at the drake's neck!
The drake you created is the wrong sex. Look at the XY chromosomes. Males have one Y and one X chromosome while females have two X chromosomes.
The sex of your drake doesn't match the target drake. Change the slider from [selectedSex] to [targetSex].

LG1.C2a
Siblings
These parents cannot produce both sibling drakes.

[targetTrait: Dull, Wingless, Armless, Legless, Orange, Horns] is a recessive trait. Each parent must have at least one recessive [targetTrait: dull, wingless, armless, legless, orange, horns] allele to produce a baby that is [targetTrait: dull, wingless, armless, legless, orange, horns].

These parents cannot produce both sibling drakes. Set at least one of [incorrectParent: the mom's, the dad's, each parent's] alleles to [targetTrait: dull, wingless, armless, legless, orange, horns] and breed again!
LG1.C2b
Siblings
These parents cannot produce both sibling drakes.

[targetTrait: Shiny, Wings, Arms, Legs, Gray, Hornless] is a dominant trait. One parent must have at least one dominant [targetTrait: shiny, wings, arms, legs, gray, hornless] allele to produce a baby that is [targetTrait: shiny, wings, arms, legs, gray, hornless].

These parents cannot produce both sibling drakes. Set at least one of [incorrectParent: the mom's, the dad's, each parent's] alleles to [targetTrait: shiny, wings, arms, legs, gray, hornless] and breed again!
LG1.C2c
Siblings
These parents cannot produce both sibling drakes. Look at the parents' [attribute: nose spike, deep color] alleles again.
[attribute: Nose spike, Deep color] is a sex-linked trait. Male drakes cannot pass their [attribute: nose spike, deep color] allele to their sons but they can pass this allele to their daughters!
These parents cannot produce both sibling drakes. Change [incorrectParent: the mom's, the dad's, each parent's] [attribute: nose spike, deep color] alleles and breed again!
LG1.C2d
Siblings
These parents cannot produce both sibling drakes. Look at the parents [attribute: tails] alleles again.
[attribute: Tails] is a gene with three alleles. Long tails are the most dominant and short tails are the most recessive. Kinked tails are dominant to short tails but recessive to long tails!
These parents cannot produce both sibling drakes. Change [incorrectParent: the mom's, the dad's, each parent's] [attribute: tails] alleles and breed again!
LG1.C2a
Breeding

How can you change the [incorrectParent: mom's, dad's, parent's] alleles to produce a drake that [targetTrait: is shiny, has wings, has arms, has legs, is grey, has color, is hornless, has a nose spike, has deep color]?

[targetTrait: Shiny, Wings, Arms, Legs, Grey, Color, Hornless, Nose spike, Deep color] is a dominant trait. One parent must have at least one dominant [targetTrait: shiny, wings, arms, legs, grey, color, hornless, spike, deep] allele to produce a baby that [targetTrait: is shiny, has wings, has arms, has legs, is grey, has color, is hornless, has a nose spike, has deep color].

These parents cannot produce the target drake. Set at least one of [incorrectParent: the mom's, the dad's, each parent's] alleles to [targetTrait: shiny, wings, arms, legs, grey, color, hornless, spike, deep]. Sometimes it takes a while to get the target drake. Just keep breeding!

[targetTrait: Dull is, Wingless is, Armless is, Legless is, Orange is, Albino is , Horns are, Spikeless is, Faded color is, Short tails are] a recessive trait. Each parent must have at least one recessive [targetTrait: dull, wingless, armless, legless, orange, albino, horns, spikeless, faded, short] allele to produce a baby that  [targetTrait: is dull, is wingless, is armless, is legless, is orange, is albino, has horns, is spikeless, has faded color, has a short tail].

These parents cannot produce the target drake. Set at least one of [incorrectParent: the mom's, the dad's, each parent's] alleles to [targetTrait: dull, wingless, armless, legless, orange, albino, horns, spikeless, faded, short tail]. Sometimes it takes a while to get the target drake. Just keep breeding!

Kinked tails and long tails are dominant to short tails. What can you change about [incorrectParent: the mom's, the dad's, each parent's] alleles to produce a baby with a [targetTrait: long tail, kinked tail, short tail]?
To produce a baby drake that has a [targetTrait: long, kinked, short] tail, change [incorrectParent: the mom's, the dad's, each parent's] alleles and see what happens!

Sim
Let's think only about [attribute: nose spikes, deep color]. Male drakes have only one X chromosome. This one allele controls the drake's trait.
[attribute: Nose spike is, Deep color is] a dominant trait. If a male drake has the "[targetTrait: spiked, deep]" allele, it will [targetTrait: have a nose spike, have deep color].

Your drake is still [selectedTrait: spikeless, faded color, spiked, deep color]! To make a drake that [targetTrait: has a nose spike, has deep color, is spikeless, has faded color], set the allele on the X chromosome to [targetTrait: spiked, deep, spikeless, faded] and see what happens!
LG1.C2d
Sim
Let's look closely at [attribute: tails]. There are three different tail alleles!
Kinked tails and long tails are dominant to short tails.

Your drake still has a [selectedTrait: tail]! To make a drake that [targetTrait: has a kinked tail, has a short tail, has a long tail], set alleles [targetTrait: so that there is at least one kinked tail and no long tail, to two short tails, so that there is at least one long tail allele] and see what happens!
